sen.j: 建水（けんすい）は茶を入れるときに使用する道具の一つ。
sen.e: Kensui is one of the utensils which are used for making tea.

sen.j: 材質は陶器、磁器、曲物、金属器など。
sen.e: In the case of making tea with matcha (powdered green tea) in Sado (Japanese tea ceremony), materials of kensui are earthenware, porcelain, magemono (wooden bucket), metal artifact, etc.

sen.j: 席入り（茶室への入場）の最後に、中に蓋置、口に柄杓をかけ、左手で口を持って入り、手前座に着く
sen.e: At the end of seki-iri (entering the tea-ceremony room called chashitsu and taking your seat), you bring the kensui into the room holding its mouth by the left hand, with a futa-oki (a rest for the lid of a teakettle) in the kensui and a hishaku (a ladle) over the mouth of it, and sit down on the temae-za (the place where the host sits when he prepares tea in the tea-ceremony room).

sen.j: 一端左手に柄杓を持ち、右手で中から蓋置を取り出し所定の位置に置く
sen.e: You hold the hishaku by the left hand once, and take out the futa-oki from the kensui by the right hand and place it on its appointed position.
